Oprah Winfrey, one of the richest women in the United States (and probably the world) grew up dirt poor. Regardless if you believe it or not, people in this country do have equal opportunity; what is not equal is determination, motivation, good work ethic, and intelligent management of finances. These characteristics make the difference between people who succeed and people who fail. Your ability to succeed and live well has nothing to do with your race. I am by no means rich but I am able to get a loan to go to college which I don't have to start paying back until 6 months after I graduate. Many many programs like this exist to help people advance in life, and they are available to anybody who wants them. However, the sad truth is that most people would rather sit around and complain about how unfair everything is without even attempting to help themselves. This is certainly much easier than actually getting off your XXX and doing something with your life. I heard a saying once that went something along the lines of: "Men who say they can and men who say they can't are both right."

 
 There is a lot to be said for getting off your XXX. I agree many people need to do it more. But to say there is equal opportunity is dead wrong. A kid being raised in the inner city by people with little education and income and attending schools that are struggling just to stay safe and a kid growing up in the burbs with money and high performing schools may both have access the grants and loans at college time - but say they had equal opportunity is pretty blind.
